intro: Eriocaulon pallidum, commonly known as the pale spikerush, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae, characterized by its grass-like appearance and specialized adaptations for aquatic or semi-aquatic habitats. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, white or pale flowers. Its rhizomes are often submerged, helping it anchor in muddy or aquatic soils. Eriocaulon pallidum plays a role in stabilizing wetland ecosystems and providing habitat for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
